results.title: The Mummy returns
results.creator_credit: Steven Somers, James Jacks, Sean Daniel, Alphaville and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz and Arnold Vosloo return to star in this sequel to the 1999’s blockbuster, ‘The Mummy’. When evil mummy Lord Imhotep is resurrected in a British museum, Rich and Evie O’Connell develop feelings of deja-vu. The situation worsens when their son Alexander discovers the ancient arm bands belonging to the Scorpion King and puts them on, which will awaken the Scorpion King and bring forth the end of the world. When Imhotep discovers the wearer of the bracelets and the only thing standing in his way of reigning again is a child, he arranges for the child to be kidnapped, leaving Evie and Rich only days to save their son and the world from Imhotep and the Scorpion King. Cast also includes wrestling star The Rock, AKA Dwayne Johnson, as the Scorpion King.

results.title: Hoop dreams
results.creator_credit: Steve James, Frederick Marx, Peter Gilbert, Kartemquin Films and KTCA-TV (Television station : Saint Paul, Minn.)
results.brief_description: ‘Hoop Dreams’ follows two star basketball players over five years, beginning when they are just fourteen and heading for high school careers that will make or break their dreams of becoming stars in the NBA. Arthur Agee and William Gates emerge as distinct characters, engaging the audience in an almost heartbreaking degree of emotional identification with the hurdles they both have to overcome. Unlike many sports films that climax with the supreme triumph of victory in the big game, this film challenges the definition of what constitutes winning. Winner of the Audience Award at the Sundance Film Festival in 1994.

results.title: The Passion of the Christ
results.creator_credit: Mel Gibson, Bruce Davey, Stephen McEveety and ICON
results.brief_description: Written (with Benedict Fitzgerald), directed and produced by Mel Gibson, “The Passion of the Christ” is the realisation of a very personal project for Gibson. The film deals with the last twelve hours of Jesus of Nazareth’s life opening in the Garden of Gethsemane. Betrayed by the disciple Judas, Jesus (Jim Caviezel) is arrested and stands accused of blasphemy before religious leaders, who insist he should be punished by death. Before the crucifixion however, he is whipped and beaten and the graphic nature of the violence (torturous instruments that remove chunks of flesh shown in slow-motion) may prove too much for some viewers. The film employs the use of brief flashbacks as a vehicle to cover the last supper and life-changing experiences of other important people in his life; namely disciples, his mother Mary and Mary Magdalene. This religious drama uses the original languages of the day as an attempt to add to a more timeless and authentic telling of the story. Production design and cinematography give the film a painterly feel and majestic musical score adds to the emotional intensity, particularly at times when no dialogue is spoken. Cast includes, Maia Morgenstern, Hristo Jivkov, Monica Bellucci, Rosalinda Celentano.

results.title: The River [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mark Rydell, Edward Lewis, Robert Cortess and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Family drama set in Eastern Tennessee. It tells the story of the trials and tribulations that beset a young farming family. Threatened by an overflowing weir, the modern world of big business and a bad harvest, the head of the family is forced to become a scab labourer in the local foundry during the strike, leaving his wife in charge of the homestead. Cast includes Mel Gibson and Sissy Spacek.

results.title: Kelly's heroes
results.creator_credit: Brian G. Hutton, Gabriel Katzka, Sidney Beckerman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This World War II comedy drama finds a quartet of American soldiers attempting to steal 16 million dollars in gold bullion from the Nazis. A captured German officer reveals the location of the precious metal, and Kelly recruits Big Joe, Crapgame and tank operator Oddball for the heist. Battlefield violence combines with humour and drama as the four break through enemy lines and go for the gold. General Colt is the livid commander who soon realises the men have broken through a seemingly impenetrable line of defending Nazis. Cast includes: Clint Eastwood, Telly Savalas, Don Rickles, Carroll O’Connor and Donald Sutherland.

results.title: Irma La Douce
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Daniel Mandell, Edward Alperson, Billy Wilder and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: Comedy set in the red-light district of Paris, where Irma La Douce (Shirley MacLaine) is a “working girl”. A naive gendarme (Jack Lemmon) falls for the beautiful Irma after conducting a one-man raid on a notorious backstreet establishment. He becomes Irma’s “business manager” but soon becomes insanely jealous of her clientele and in despair, devises a clever way to keep her all to himself. MacLaine and Lemmon display their impressive comic talents under Billy Wilder’s direction. This screen adaptation was based on the successful Broadway musical.

results.title: Oklahoma!
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman, Orry-Kelly, George Boemler, Arthur Hornblow, Magna Corporation and Rodgers and Hammerstein
results.brief_description: Set in the Oklahoma Territory in the early 1900s “Oklahoma!” is an idealised vision of a simpler time, a story of tender romance and violent passion. With choreography by Agnes De Mille, the score is ripe with classics: “Oh, What A Beautiful Mornin’”, “The Surrey With The Fringe On Top”, “People Will Say We’re In Love” “Oaklahoma” and many more. This was the first Rodgers and Hammerstein collaboration, starting the most successful creative partnership in the history of musical theatre.

results.title: Last dance
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Steven Haft and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: After 12 years behind bars for a double murder, Cindy Liggett is prepared to die. What she is not prepared for is the relationship she develops with the man assigned to save her life, attorney Rick Hayes. Cast includes Sharon Stone, Rob Morrow, Randy Quaid, Peter Gallagher, Jack Thompson.

results.title: The Long kiss goodnight (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Renny Harlin, Shane Black, Stephanie Austin, Forge and Steve Tisch
results.brief_description: Samantha Cain (Geena Davis) is a school teacher who for the past 8 years has suffered amnesia. Haunted by bizarre flashbacks, she hires private detective Mitch (Samuel L. Jackson), to discover her true identity. They discover that Samantha is actually a lethal government assassin, presumed dead and that’s the way the authorities would like to keep it. Samantha is now hunted by her past and a string of government agents who have placed a contract on her life and kidnapped her daughter.

results.title: Yol
results.creator_credit: Serif Goren, Yilmaz Guney, Edi Hubschmid, Cactus Films, DRS, Films A2, Guney Film, Maran Film and Schweizer Fernselen
results.brief_description: Five political prisoners are given one week’s reprieve to go and visit their families. One man returns to find that his adulterous wife is being kept prisoner by his father-in-law who expects him to kill her. Another returns to his village but cannot marry the woman he loves because custom decrees he must marry his widowed sister-in-law; another finds his family has shunned him for confessing to the authorities. As the men spread out across Turkey’s vast terrain, “Yol” explores the strictures of tradition on family and on marriage. The men, all of whom must return to their prison cells, are prisoners of an authoritarian state. Their women and their children are prisoners of an equally authoritarian patriarchy. Guney was himself a political prisoner, incarcerated for his intellectual activism against state militarism, when he wrote the script to “Yol”, which was smuggled out to Serif Goren, who directed the film for Guney. Guney escaped to Switzerland where he completed the film. Though the social, political and gender relationships explored in the film are harsh and unrelenting, what is transcendant about “Yol” is the deeply rigorous humanism that Guney and Goren extend to all their characters. That Guney and Goren were able to complete the film is a testament itself to their intelligence and dedication to a cinema of enlightenment. This film is one of cinema’s greatest laments against the violence of patriarchy and one of the great emancipist works about the possibilities of change and transformation. (Awards: Winner of the Palme d’Or at Cannes. Winner of the International Critic’s Prize) In Turkish with English subtitles.
